So said  Steven Taschuk  on  2002-11-14 

>Quoth J. B. Rainsberger:
>  [...=
]
>> Now, had I been in control of my own DDL, I might not have written
>> =
those tests; however, since I designed my component to abstract away
>> per=
sistence, I wrote those tests to ensure that my in-memory
>> implementation=
 of the persistent objects worked correctly. It needed to
>> reject the sam=
e kinds of duplicates that the database would.
>  [...]
>
>Vaguely on this =
subject:
>
>Does there exist a JDBC driver for a transient in-memory store?=

>I'd like to use such a thing as a mock database for testing that
>code ma=
kes proper use of JDBC.  Testing such things as:
>  - Proper use of JDBC es=
capes (exposed when the driver uses some weird
>    syntax for various kind=
s of literals).
>  - Adaptation to (or graceful failure in) the absence of =
certain SQL
>    features.
>  - Graceful failure in the case of violation o=
f data constraints.
>
>I also imagine configuring the driver to emulate var=
ious real
>drivers, to test portability across databases.
>
>Any suggestion=
s?

I had been thinking of writing one that included things like deadlock d=
etection and the like, but I never got around to it. I got another job, ins=
tead. :)
